Blog.post: Well, kind of. I mean, what do I care if it's Friday? Just the same as any other day to me. So yesterday we went to Home Depot and bought everything we need to clean and stain the fence. Our "plan" is to clean it today and stain it tomorrow. Well, good thing the fence isn't going anywhere because it looks like our plans will change. Delay #1 - Nicholas got into an ant hill (AGAIN) while we were finishing up the "in" side of the fence. Delay #2 - it's raining. It's supposed to rain tomorrow, too. At least we have all the stuff now. Once we get past this cleaning stage I think it will be pretty easy. Scrubbing the fence by hand is no fun, but it sure is making a difference! I will post some before & after pictures once it's all done. My poor, ant-bitten baby is sleeping now. I guess the Benadryl knocked him out. At least that way he's not itching. :( Two more days until Zach comes home! Yay! Registration for school is next Tuesday. It's looking pretty gloomy outside. I hope it doesn't rain all weekend. Whatever your weekend plans are, I hope you and your loved ones are happy, healthy, and safe. Have a good one. - Megan

That means Wednesday... get your mind out of the gutter! Nicholas skipped his morning nap today, but he is more than making up for it right now. We went for a walk around the neighborhood earlier today and he fell asleep on the way home. He's been asleep ever since - and that was 3 hours ago! If he'd do this every day I wouldn't mind him only taking one nap. It's almost like having free time to myself, except I can't go anywhere. What else? I don't live a life of adventure and excitement, so if that's what you're looking for you'll have to find another blog! I want to go to a nursery and get some new plants and shrubs for our flowerbeds. The front of our house looks so... drab! Especially compared to some of the other houses in our subdivision. I've wanted to work on it for a while now, but it's just so freaking HOT outside. Today isn't too bad, though. Anyway, the beds really need some work. Some color, some new shrubs... I want to put a big, long bed down the side of the house, too. And some stuff in the backyard. Me and my grand plans. I have tons of 'em. Next on my list is staining the fence! That is one I really could do soon, if I'd get off my rear and DO it. I guess there's no reason why Nicholas and I can't take a ride to Home Depot when he wakes up. At least find out how much all this will cost me. That's about it for this grand Wednesday. More fun-filled entries to come.

I tried to think of a clever title for today's post, but I'm just not up to being creative right now so you get "Tuesday". Nicholas has surprised me and slept late for the past two mornings! Yesterday he slept until 8:50 and today until 8:30. I could get used to this. Of course, Zach starts school in two weeks so all this "sleeping in" will be a moot point. That's okay, I'll enjoy it while I can. I'm going to start teaching some border classes to my CM customers (well, to anyone who is interested, really). Oh, just in case you don't know what CM is... see urlLink http://www.creativememories.com . I've been doing some research today to get ideas for which borders to include in the class(es). I think this will be really easy and fun once I've got a plan, but it's going to take a lot of work to get it set up. I will have to decide on which borders to use (either 4 or 6), then I will have to practice making them so I can write up step-by-step instructions. I will also have to make a supplies list AND have enough of everything in stock! Ideally I would also have everything in stock so the participants could buy supplies to take home with them, but that might just have to wait. I can always order it for them. I have way too much inventory right now anyway. Joseph is working nights this week, so most of my time is spent hanging out with Nicholas. We might go wash my car when he wakes up from his nap. It sure could use it! Well, I can't think of anything interesting so say so I will end this for today. -Megan

And so it begins. Today I sent my oldest son, Zach, off to start 5th grade. His last year at his elementary school. I had to go to the bus stop with him to talk to the driver about which stop he can use. Thankfully, that went just fine. Zach even got on the bus and left without telling me and Nicholas goodbye! Later this morning I took Nicholas to a photo shoot. Amber Parmley, of urlLink http://www.parmleyphotography.com/ , was doing some complimentary photo shoots for members of Mommies of the Midsouth ( urlLink http://www.mommiesofthemidsouth.com ). She does really great work and I can't wait to see the shots she got of Nicholas. We kind of turned it into a mini playgroup, since there were so many of us there all at the same time. It was nice. We didn't leave until a little after 1, then we came home and Nicholas had his lunch. He didn't sleep during his morning nap time, so I just put him down for his afternoon nap a little early. I hope this time he actually does sleep. I should be sleeping, too. I only got 2 1/2 hours of sleep last night, thanks to the latest book from this man: urlLink http://www.harlancoben.com . I just COULD NOT put it down! So I was up until 4:15 this morning reading the whole damn thing. I knew at the time that I would regret it today, but I just couldn't help myself. I'm actually doing better today than I expected. I'm sure I will crash early tonight. Well, today's post sure does seem to be full of links! I wish I could embed the link in the text...maybe there's a way to do that and I just haven't figured it out yet. What else is new? I know I haven't posted in several days so I'm sure I'm leaving something out. Well, the fence is finally finished. It does look good. We probably have some touch-ups to do, but overall it looks really good. I'm glad we did it. I guess my next big project will be Nicholas's room. We'll see. That's all I can think of right now with my sleep-deprived brain. I hope you had a good weekend and your week is off to a good start. Do Good & Win! - Megan

because we've done it. Went okay, I guess. Had a little disagreement about the bus stop Zach was assigned to, but in the grand scheme of things it could have been a lot worse. I had an old-age reality check today while I was driving. I heard "Jenny (867-5309)" by Tommy Tutone ( urlLink http://www.tutone.com/ ). There was the line "for the price of a dime I can always turn to you..." and it got me to thinking. I actually REMEMBER when pay phones cost a dime! Which led to the thought yeah, and I remember when they went up to 25 cents, and then 35 cents... which made me wonder how much it costs to use a pay phone today... which then led to the question of do they even HAVE pay phones anymore?!? With the popularity and ease of cell phones, does Bellsouth even bother putting pay phones out anywhere? I can't remember the last time I saw one, much less used one... and then by this point in my train of thought I started feeling really old. Lots of things make me feel old lately, though. Like realizing that my big brother/best friend in high school is the dad of a now-16-year-old daughter! I remember when he and his wife told me they were having a baby... (Hi Russ and Judy!)... time flies when you're having fun, huh? I've been out of high school for 17 years. I laugh to the point of tears at the "I Love the 80's" series on VH1 and think the "I Love the 90's" series has come out just a few years too soon. I am definitely an 80's girl. Granted, I wouldn't be 14 again for anything, but man, those were the days. Okay, I feel a big rambling bout of reminiscence coming on, so I will end for today. So long, be good, and be careful. Or, as my friend Elease says, "Do Good & Win!" -Megan
